course_description: This course in Business Economics will provide the fundamental tools in understanding the workings of markets and those participating in markets. Topics from microeconomics include the following: demand functions, production and supply functions, elasticity, market equilibrium, the theory of consumer choice, market efficiency, externalities, price controls and tax, market structure, and profitability. Topics from macroeconomics include: macroeconomic statistics, models of aggregates, the workings of the Federal Reserve Bank, monetary policy, fiscal policy, labor markets, and trade. We will also cover an introduction to finance.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the Emory College Liberal Arts and Sciences program.
